pros: Good and experience lecturers to work with

pros: Good team members, interesting work, improved student wellfare and interactions with other teams and departments.
cons: Internal politics, college reputation often is prioritised over best practice and transparency.

review_title: Mostly good, but with bad management
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Watford, East of England, England
pros:
Nice staff who mostly work together for the benefit of the students
Good IT facilities and facilities departments and services.
Nice campuses
Lots of opportunities to learn new skills
Good work life balance
cons:
Minimal or non-existent training for staff
Countless re-structuring has left massive holes in the business processes, some departments overstaffed, others understaffed.
Major problems with the senior leadership team's performance, decision making and behaviour towards staff
Limited or non-existent promotion prospects
Massive and unexplainable salary differences for managers at the same level

pros: Nice work environment beautiful grounds, work life balance ok for some departments, people like teaching students. Enjoyed working there people passionate about teaching.
cons: Not competitive in some ways, parking can be a nightmare, some senior managers are not as good as others. Could look at introducing some more flexible benefits.

pros: The grounds of Smallford campus is the only positive
cons:
Appalling and authoritative leadership style /management 
Overworked staff
High staff turnover
Safeguarding procedures not adhered to
Lessons not covered in many cases 
The college just wants to grab your cash and then leave you to it! They will let pretty much anyone enrol and they'll let pretty much anyone stay, no matter how many disciplinaries a student gets they rarely, if ever, get thrown out.

job_title: Associate Lecturer in Saint Albans, England
pros: Great teachers who try their best.
cons: Ridiculous management, over worked and everyone is miserable and unhappy with their jobs
